Pre-Game Insights: As the Chicago White Sox face off against the Baltimore Orioles on September 2, 2024, all eyes will be on Ryan O'Hearn. With the White Sox struggling this season and the Orioles in playoff contention, O'Hearn's performance could be crucial.

The Chicago White Sox (31-107) are set to take on the Baltimore Orioles (79-59) at Oriole Park at Camden Yards on September 2, 2024. This matchup kicks off a three-game series between these two teams, with the Orioles looking to extend their lead in the AL East.
Chris Flexen will take the mound for the White Sox, boasting a record of 2-13 with a 5.29 ERA, while the Orioles' Corbin Burnes comes in with a solid 12-7 record and a 3.23 ERA.
The Orioles currently hold the second spot in the AL East, trailing only the New York Yankees.
Historically, the Orioles have dominated the season series, currently leading 4-0 against the White Sox.
With both teams dealing with injuries, the White Sox will be without key players like Yoan Moncada and Mike Clevinger, while the Orioles are missing Dean Kremer and Ramon Urias.
